dt: {bc}any of a family (Cucurbitaceae, the gourd family) of chiefly herbaceous tendril-bearing vines including the cucumber, melon, squash, and pumpkin
{bc}any of various hard-rinded inedible fruits of plants of two genera ({it}Lagenaria{/it} and {it}Cucurbita{/it}) often used for ornament or for vessels and utensils

dt.t: Walking through the various barrios, you might see people sharing sips from a little {wi}gourd{/wi} with a straw in it.
… a basketball-size {wi}gourd{/wi} draped with a veil of wooden beads—to incite individual bursts of improvisation from the orchestra's players.
… comes off like a cross between two Hogans, the Aussie actor Paul and the American wrestler Hulk—completely {wi}out of his gourd{/wi}, but essentially likable.
… these people are loud, abusive, occasionally maniacal, often colossally boorish and notoriously primed under certain circumstances to go totally {wi}off their gourds{/wi}.
was frightened {wi}out of her gourd{/wi} {gloss}=extremely frightened{/gloss}
It's eleven against two, and the two are probably stoned {wi}out of their gourds{/wi}.

Perhaps it is not too late for American kids to be given the gift of enforced boredom for at least a week or two, staring into space, bored {wi}out of their gourds{/wi}, exploring the inside of their own heads.

et: Middle English {it}gourde{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}gurde, gourde{/it}, from Latin {it}cucurbita{/it}
shortdef: any of a family (Cucurbitaceae, the gourd family) of chiefly herbaceous tendril-bearing vines including the cucumber, melon, squash, and pumpkin
the fruit of a gourd : pepo; especially : any of various hard-rinded inedible fruits of plants of two genera (Lagenaria and Cucurbita) often used for ornament or for vessels and utensils

dt: {bc}a common cultivated gourd ({it}Lagenaria siceraria{/it}) having a variably shaped fruit with a hard shell that is sometimes used as a container

shortdef: a common cultivated gourd (Lagenaria siceraria) having a variably shaped fruit with a hard shell that is sometimes used as a container

dt: {bc}a perennial foul-smelling cucurbit ({it}Cucurbita foetidissima{/it}) of arid lands of the central and southwest U.S. and Mexico with a large starchy taproot and seeds rich in oil

shortdef: a perennial foul-smelling cucurbit (Cucurbita foetidissima) of arid lands of the central and southwest U.S. and Mexico with a large starchy taproot and seeds rich in oil
